body: It's nice to have an ap that keeps you honest, gives good tips and covers all your basis.  I particularly like how easy it is too look up food and enter recipes

title: Minus one star for not having IPad app.
body: Best diabetes tracker I have used thus far. Easy to keep track of food, exercise, insulin, etc. I just wish they would make an iPad app since I switch back and forth between my phone and iPad.

title: Great Help
body: awesome app but the only problem is just about barcode you scan is not recognized but when you search the same food it's in the database 70% of the time so that needs to be updated also I honestly do not think its worth $9.99 way to high a price for this

title: My net diary
body: Great. It manages my diet and I can easily keep track of not only calories but also carbs, sodium, cholesterol, sugar etc. I've been using it for about 6 weeks and have lost over 15 lbs!

title: Disappointed with Charts
body: I upgraded to the Pro version, thinking I'd get some decent charting for my blood sugar levels and a way to email a report. If it's there, I'm not seeing it. I checked out their website and it doesn't seem to offer any diabetic reporting. Pointless to enter all the data if it can't be used to produce a high-low-average sugar chart to help me see trends and adjust my medications.

title: Excellent
body: If your diabetic this is the program for you. Don't look any further. This is the perfect program to control your blood sugar and loose the weight you need.

title: Has Everything
body: Has everything a newly diagnosed diabetic should use to keep track. I use it all day, everyday. It also can sync with a Fitbit.

title: Thank you
body: I started using this tracker when I was diagnosed pre diabetic.  In 4 weeks my body feels better for helping me track my caloric intake and carbs.  I have lost over 20 lbs.

title: Best money I've ever spent!
body: After struggling for years to balance eating for IBD and diabetes (polar opposite diets), I found this app and it allowed me to gain control. I've lost almost 20 pounds and my a1c has gone from 8.4 to 6.4.

title: A Must Have For Diabetics
body: Used for several months now.  This app is the easiest tool I've ever used to maintain my weight and blood sugar levels. I highly recommend it.

title: RAtracker
body: Love this app. I have problems keeping my weight up and this helps me to track my Whole Foods intake to make sure I'm getting my calories. Love the blood pressure tracker and diabetes tracker

title: Thank You for This App!
body: I love this app!  Perfect tool for managing your health on a daily basis and tracking progress.  For the first time, I am seeing real results due to better information.

title: First App review
body: I have been a diabetic (insulin dependent), for 15+ yrs. have fought A1C all those yrs (readings range 8.3 - 7.3). This App gave me the missing link for full control and weight loss as a plus. Now have all readings below 7.0.

title: What?!
body: This is one of the best apps out there. However, it has since stopped syncing with Runkeeper. If this is a ploy to get me to spend another $2 to get THEIR activity tracker, no thanks. I'll update when this is fixed.

title: My net diary
body: Great product. Continuous improvement on the app with increased features. It works well with my fitness,  diabetes, and calorie intake. I have recommended to multiple people I know.

title: Love it!
body: This app is wonderful! It's easy to use and contains the information I need to track my glucose levels, as well as my calorie intake. I highly recommend it!

title: Intuitive, easy to use and fits in well with my life!
body: Having one place to keep track of pretty much everything concerning my health is great!

title: Worth your time worth your investment
body: Intuitive great user interface. Easy to log. Vast array of charts. Allows you to be as detailed as you want. Everything related to health.

title: Comprehensive
body: Very comprehensive as far as macro & micro nutrient tracking. Entry is easy and pretty quick. I have tried others but this one seems to meet my needs the best.

title: Luv it
body: If you want to lose weight, MyNetDiary is a must app to have. It is so easy to enter data and keep up with your progress. I have lost 32 pounds so far with 15 more to go.

title: Love this app
body: Easy to use and helps me stay on track. I needed a way to keep track of my blood sugar and exercise --- I like having an app that covers so much.

title: Great
body: So far this is a great app. It has everything I am suppose to monitor. I have not been to the website but I hope there is a printable record I can take to the dr office.

title: Upgrade review
body: I agree with first review. Would like to see carb amount upon opening item. Like the food score number system over letter grade. Overall great app!

title: My Net Diary Review
body: This app is very user friendly and easy to use. It is wonderful to be able to have both dietary and diabetic management in the same app. Very happy. Thank you!

title: Very comprehensive app
body: Glad to have at last found an attractive, easy to use app that tracks food and blood glucose - very helpful for diabetes management!

title: MyNetDiary
body: I like everything about this app. I would like to see a simple chart that shows date, time, blood glucose readings and amount of insulin taken.

title: Love the Grading
body: Very helpful to grade the food knowing what is good to eat what's not good to eat… Somethings kind of shocked me on the rating they got which was a surprise because it added more choices in my diet

title: Database of foods is not very complete
body: Database of foods is lacking a lot. While I love the ease of tracking carbs with this app, it isn't much use without thorough options. I will be returning to my fitness pal because their food choices are very well done. Sorry I spent money on this app.

title: Great help
body: I found this app at the suggestion of my brother.  It tracks everything I need to do daily.  Now I would be lost without it

title: Can't enter blood glucose readings!
body: I have recently been diagnosed with type 2 diabetes. I bought this app with the expectation that I could monitor my blood glucose levels, but although there are charts for blood glucose readings. How in the hell does one enter their blood glucose levels? The main page allows one to enter exercise, meals, steps, water intake, and you can even monitor custom setting. BUT NOT BLOOD GLUCOSE LEVELS.

title: Best diabetic App
body: After having tried several helps for keeping track of all the different aspects of diabetes, this is by far the best.

title: Health
body: Great app does what it claims. Very handy at keeping track of your diabetes. Very easy to use. More food options and restaurants needed. Allow to sync with workout apps

title: Saving my life!
body: Before this app my numbers were all over the place! My lowest reading was 240.  This app has helped me to understand what foods make my sugar spike and what foods keep me within the normal range. I've had this app for a month and I've already lost 9 lbs just by logging what I eat and making adjustments. The only complaint I have is that the food "database" is limited, but the bar code reader makes up for that. At my two week check up my doctor was so impressed with the chart that he went and got his phone and bought the app on the spot. The nutritionist they sent me to did the same thing. I have found this app extremely helpful. I've read books and know what I should and should not eat, but knowing never helped. Seeing the results plotted out on the chart and seeing how each food impacted my numbers has been a game changer for me.
